text: Figure 1). In March 2013, 24 4-m long hybrid poplar cuttings of the Grimminge cultivar [Populus deltoides (Populus tricocarpa Populus deltoides)] were planted on the field for future phytoremediation purposes. The trees were distributed over a defined rectangular grid of 10 by 35 , enclosing the area with the highest concentrations of chlorendic acid in the groundwater (>100 ) (Figure 1).
